title: Contrastive and Transfer Learning for Effective Audio Fingerprinting through a Real-World Evaluation Protocol
author: Christos Nikou (Multimedia Analysis Group of the Computational Intelligence Laboratory, Institute of Informatics and Telecommunications, NCSR 'DEMOKRITOS'), Theodoros Giannakopoulos (Multimedia Analysis Group of the Computational Intelligence Laboratory, Institute of Informatics and Telecommunications, NCSR 'DEMOKRITOS')
relevance_why: The paper discusses novel methods in music recognition systems, particularly using contrastive and transfer learning, which could be applied to Haohe Liu's work in audio processing and generation tasks, enhancing robustness in real-world applications.
background: Improving song identification systems by ensuring robust performance in real-world noisy environments, specifically focusing on audio fingerprinting.
contribution: This paper introduces a new evaluation protocol and a transformer-based architecture, addressing performance drops associated with real-world audio distortions, achieving improved accuracy under various noise conditions.

technical_comparison.prior_work: Existing audio fingerprinting methods typically perform well in controlled settings but fail under real-world conditions with noise.
technical_comparison.novelty: This work integrates a novel augmentation strategy and a transformer architecture, demonstrating significant robustness improvements over prior CNN-based approaches.

key_innovation: The combination of contrastive learning with a custom augmentation strategy using low and high pass filters enhances the model's accuracy in noisy conditions, along with transfer learning from a semantically relevant domain.
real_world_impact: By presenting a more realistic performance evaluation and enhancing model robustness, this research can significantly improve practical audio recognition applications in everyday scenarios.
limitations: No specific limitations were mentioned explicitly, though the evaluation protocol may not cover all possible distortions encountered in the wild.

new_terms.contrastive learning: **Contrastive learning** is a self-supervised representation learning approach that learns to distinguish between similar and dissimilar data points by comparing their embeddings.
new_terms.transfer learning: **Transfer learning** is the practice of leveraging knowledge or features learned from one domain (or task) to improve performance in another, often related domain.

open_sourcing: The authors have made their code publicly available on GitHub: https://github.com/magcil/deep-audio-fingerprintingbenchmark
